lines.text:
[Referring to the chair lift]
will it break down?
Well, it's a mechanical device, you know. They all break down sooner or later when the stresses and strains reach a sufficient pitch of tension.
[laughs]
You know, only the unsuccessful murderers disclose their crimes.
And the successful ones?
Well, they draw their reward from a feeling of personal power.

[to Alan]
Tesoro, I've lied for you but never to you.

[Screaming]
Ahhhhhhh!

[Annoyed]
Now what?
A spider!
Oh, it's quite harmless... unless you're a male spider. This is a female.
You sure have good eyesight!
No, the male is always small, and, in case you're interested, he gets eaten by the female after he has performed his necessary function.

[In French]
Ooo lala!
Ah, you know, women tend to do the same thing.
I must say I have never tried it.

[laughs]
I mean mentally and psychologically.
You've obviously talked to a lot of spiders.
No, but I've talked to men, and, like spiders, many of them enjoy being eaten psychologically.

[Alan seems to react negatively to this last remark]
You can take me off the list.
Oh, some fight against it. It's a mechanism of this sort, a bid to stave off being eaten by women which operates in certain individuals.
[Alan again appears to take Prade's remark personally]
Is that why you're a bachelor?
[Everybody laughs]
Or before you know it, people are showing you their mole, or asking if smoking really causes cancer. Cigarette?
